channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: Morning new brief
item.description: Authorities investigative motive behind Minnesota mass shooting, CDC director is out after less than a moth in the job, ex-Biden administration officials detail contentious talks over Israel's war in Gaza.

item.title: Authorities investigate motive behind Minnesota mass shooting
item.description: Authorities identified a suspect and now they are working to figure out why a 23 year old shot and killed 2 school children and wounded 17 other people at a Catholic school and church in Minneapolis.

item.title: Father felt like 'throwing up' when he learned of shooting at daughter's school
item.description: A father shares his four-year-old daughter's experience hiding in a church basement home to her preschool as gunfire erupted upstairs at Annunciation Catholic Church in Minneapolis.

item.title: Minnesota attorney general on Wednesday's mass shooting in Minneapolis
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with Minnesota Attorney General Keith Ellison about Wednesday's mass shooting at a Catholic church and school in Minneapolis.

item.title: Author of book on Hurricane Katrina debunks myths and misconceptions
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Andy Horowitz, author of "Katrina: A History 1915-2015," about misconceptions post-Hurricane Katrina and his assertion that what happened in 2005 was entirely predictable.

item.title: Ex-Biden administration officials detail contentious talks over Israel's war in Gaza
item.description: NPR reporters have uncovered some of the tensions within the Biden administration as the U.S. responded to Israel's war in Gaza.

item.title: After Katrina, a Mississippi businessman invests in a restaurant and in a community
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with business owner Ron Ladner about the community he invested in after Hurricane Katrina devasted the town of Pass Christian, on the Mississippi waterfront.

item.title: Siberian forest cat steals the show in new action comedy 'Caught Stealing'
item.description: The new action comedy "Caught Stealing," is set in New York's East Village in the 1990s. It's an all-star cast but the real star of the show is a fluffy cat named Tonic.

item.title: The return of the pumpkin spice latte
item.description: Starbucks has brought back the Pumpkin Spice Latte for its annual fall run. But why are people so obsessed with the drink? Experts say it's a matter of marketing and food science.

item.title: Minnesota officials share their grief after Wednesday school shooting
item.description: Minnesota Governor, Tim Waltz, Senator Amy Klobuchar, and other local officials shared messages of grief and support for the families affected by the school shooting on Wednesday.
